item.title: The bank behind the fintech revolution stumbles after customer funds go missing | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Crisis at Evolve Bank After Customer Funds Go Missing

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Company Business News

Scot Lenoir has led Evolve Bank from a regional institution to a prominent player in Silicon Valley, but it now faces a crisis as customers can't access their funds, prompting withdrawals after a business partner failure.

  • Evolve Bank managed around $10 billion for fintech firms like Stripe and Affirm.
  • It provides banks to fintechs that need a partner to handle customer funds.
  • A significant number of customers are affected by the recent issues with accessing their money.
“Evolve Bank turned a sleepy farming bank into one of Silicon Valley’s top financial partners.”

This incident highlights the vulnerabilities in the fintech banking model as user trust is undermined.

item.title: Outlook 2025: Tata Steel, JSW, JSPL, SAIL others; Improvement in domestic steel prices hold key | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Outlook 2025: Tata Steel, JSW, JSPL, SAIL others; Improvement in domestic steel prices hold key

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: Live Mint

As steel prices remain largely stable, the performance of major steel stocks has varied throughout 2024. While Jindal Steel & Power has shown substantial returns, other players like Tata Steel and SAIL face challenges.

  • Jindal Steel & Power Ltd recorded a 27% return this year.
  • Tata Steel and JSW Steel have seen gains up to 5%; SAIL's shares have declined by 4-5%.
  • Factors impacting steel prices include flat domestic prices and increased imports due to weak global demand, particularly from China.
  • Concerns about rising input costs, particularly iron ore, due to proposed mining taxes in Karnataka.
  • Domestic steel demand is expected to remain resilient, but the capacity utilization of the steel industry may drop below 80%.
"Finished steel imports into India are poised to grow by 30%, touching 10 million tonne in CY2024." - Ritabrata Ghosh, ICRA Limited

The outlook for domestic steel prices in 2025 hinges on multiple factors, including international market conditions and government trade policies affecting steel imports.

item.description:
Stock picks for 2025: Rudra Murthy recommends these top 10 stocks to buy; 3 sectors he is bullish on

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Live Mint

CA Rudra Murthy B.V. advises investors to focus on value rather than momentum in 2025, emphasizing large-cap stocks amidst a challenging market for Indian stocks.

  • The benchmark indices Nifty 50 and Sensex are down nearly 9-10% from their all-time highs.
  • Murthy suggests that investors should be cautious and seek out undervalued stocks.
  • He expresses confidence in specific sectors for growth opportunities.
“Investors will be better off chasing value rather than momentum in 2025.”

Overall, Murthy's insights provide a roadmap for navigating the upcoming market uncertainties by seeking value-driven investment opportunities.

item.title: By 2030, 60% of new home buyers will be Millennials and Gen Z in India: JLL Report | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
By 2030, 60% of New Home Buyers in India Will Be Millennials and Gen Z: JLL Report

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: ANI

The JLL report anticipates that Millennials and Gen Z will make up 60% of new home buyers in India by 2030, driven by urbanization, technological innovation, and changing consumer preferences.

  • Millennials are defined as those born from the early 1980s to the early 2000s, while Gen Z covers individuals born from the mid-1990s to the early 2010s.
  • The urban homeownership rate is projected to increase from 65% in 2020 to 72% by 2025.
  • Tier II and III cities are emerging as key growth areas, responsible for over 40% of new housing development by 2025.
  • The housing sector is expected to contribute 13% to India’s national GDP by 2025.
  • Sustainability will play a crucial role, with green-certified buildings expected to double in proportion to new projects by 2025.
  • The market for smart homes and tech-integrated living spaces is rapidly expanding.
  • Residential sales are expected to see a 17% increase in 2024 compared to 2023, with total sales doubling.
"Sustainability, which was once considered a luxury, is now a necessity in the housing market."

In conclusion, the trends indicate a significant shift in the Indian housing market, with Millennials and Gen Z expected to drive demand and influence future developments.

item.title: Trade Setup for December 26: Volatility, low volumes to dominate Nifty moves on final expiry of 2024 - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Trade Setup for December 26: Volatility, low volumes to dominate Nifty moves on final expiry of 2024

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty experienced a volatile trading session, closing below 23,800 due to emerging selling pressure. Despite an optimistic start, the market shifted to a sideways-to-bearish trajectory as the December expiry approaches. Metal stocks emerged as key losers, while Tata Group stocks witnessed a significant surge.

  • The Nifty closed at 23,727.65, down 0.11%, indicating a pause in the uptrend.
  • Selling pressure was prominent near the 23,900 level, leading to a range-bound movement.
  • Tata Capital's potential IPO is anticipated to significantly impact the market.
  • Concerns over a strong dollar and high bond yields contribute to market caution.
  • Key resistance levels for the Nifty are at 23,900-24,000.
  • The Nifty Bank index showed consolidation, with key support at 50,750.
  • Market players should watch for a recovery in stocks such as Nalco India and BPCL.
“The market remains cautious due to various macroeconomic factors affecting investor sentiment.” - Vinod Nair, Geojit Financial Services

In conclusion, as the final trading session of December approaches, traders should remain alert to potential movements influenced by upcoming earnings results and budget announcements.

item.title: Market outlook 2025: Nifty 50 could correct another 5-10% in the first half, says Murthy of Vachana Investments | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Market outlook 2025: Nifty 50 could correct another 5-10% in the first half, says Murthy of Vachana Investments

Published on: December 2023
Source: Mint

Investors may face disappointment in the Indian stock market as a significant recovery is not expected until the latter half of 2025, following a forecasted decline in the Nifty 50 index.

  • Market veteran Rudra Murthy predicts a further drop of 5-10% in the Nifty during the first half of 2025.
  • Concerns over disappointing earnings, high valuations, and geopolitical issues are contributing to market corrections.
  • The Nifty 50 is projected to end the year with a low double-digit gain despite recent downturns.
  • Murthy suggests that recovery in the index may depend on upcoming Budget announcements and improvements in earnings.
  • Sectors such as pharmaceuticals and banking may offer better prospects amidst the current market challenges.
"We might see some more weakness in the Indian stock market... Recovery will start only from July onwards." - CA Rudra Murthy B.V.

In conclusion, while the outlook for the Indian stock market appears challenging in the near term, specific sectors may present investment opportunities moving forward.

item.description:
Mamata Machinery IPO Share Price: Strong Listing Ahead? Check Latest GMP

Published On: Dec 25, 2024

Source: India Today

The Mamata Machinery IPO has garnered massive interest from investors with a subscription rate close to 200 times. The IPO shares are set to debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange on December 27, 2024, following a favorable Grey Market Premium (GMP).

  • The IPO saw a subscription rate of 194.95 times by the end of the final bidding day.
  • Retail investors subscribed 138.08 times, while the QIB segment was subscribed 235.88 times.
  • The NII category registered the highest interest with 274.38 times subscription.
  • The GMP currently stands at Rs 260, suggesting a potential listing price of Rs 503 and a gain of 107% per share.
“Investors who receive allotments will see the company’s shares debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and National Stock Exchange (NSE) on Friday, December 27, 2024.”

This IPO has shown overwhelming interest, indicating strong market confidence ahead of its listing.

item.title: KKR and Bain each bid more than $5 bln for Seven | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
KKR and Bain Submit Bids Over $5 Billion for Seven & i Assets

Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Reuters

Private equity firms KKR and Bain Capital have each made bids exceeding $5 billion for non-core assets of Japan's Seven & i Holdings. The bidding marks a significant move in the retail landscape as Seven & i seeks to divest from various subsidiaries.

  • KKR's bid is approximately 800 billion yen ($5.1 billion) for York Holdings.
  • Bain Capital's offer stands around 1.2 trillion yen.
  • Japan Industrial Partners has also placed a bid of around 750 billion yen.
  • The bids surpass the expected enterprise value of 500 billion yen set by Seven & i.
  • Seven & i aims to finalize the winning bid by February 2024, with significant implications for the company's future.
“The largest privatisation of a Japanese firm, if realised, would mark a historic development in the market,” according to sources.

This bidding round indicates the companies' strategic focus on streamlining operations and responding to competitive pressures in the retail sector.

item.title: Rupee's Real Effective Exchange Rate climbs to 108.14 in Nov: RBI report - Business Standard
item.description:
Rupee's Real Effective Exchange Rate climbs to 108.14 in Nov: RBI report

Publication Date: November, 2023

Source: Reserve Bank of India

The Real Effective Exchange Rate (REER) of the rupee appreciated to 108.14 in November, showcasing resilience amidst global market pressures. This report provides insight into the currency's performance in relation to trade competitiveness.

  • REER increased from 107.20 in October to 108.14, marking a 0.9% appreciation.
  • Nominal appreciation is attributed to factors overcoming adverse price differences.
  • Emerging market currencies faced pressure while the rupee showed the lowest volatility among major currencies.
  • REER changes affect trade balance differently; depreciation tends to improve short-term trade, while appreciation has long-term benefits.
  • Several factors influence REER, including productivity, terms of trade, and government spending.
“Our empirical findings on India suggest an asymmetrical impact of REER movements on India’s trade balance,” the report noted.

Overall, while the rupee continues to appreciate, its complex interaction with global and domestic factors makes monitoring its impact on trade crucial for future economic strategies.

item.title: Applied for DAM Capital IPO shares? Allotment status check online by PAN number on Link Intime - ET Now
item.description:
Applied for DAM Capital IPO shares? Allotment status check online by PAN number on Link Intime

Updated: December 25, 2024 | Source: ET NOW

The DAM Capital IPO allotment status will be finalized today, allowing investors to check their status online using their PAN number through the Link Intime website.

DAM Capital IPO Allotment Check

The status can be accessed on the registrar's website: Link Intime.

Steps to Check Allotment Status

  1. Visit the official website of DAM Capital IPO registrar.
  2. Navigate to the IPO allotment status page of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
  3. Select the IPO from the dropdown menu once finalized.
  4. Enter your PAN number and click SUBMIT to view the allotment status.

Additionally, the allotment status will also be displayed on the BSE website.

DAM Capital IPO Subscription Status

The DAM Capital IPO was subscribed 81.88 times overall, with the NII quota subscribed 98.47 times, retail at 26.80 times, and QIB at 166.33 times. The price band was set between Rs 269-283 per share.

DAM Capital IPO GMP Latest

The latest grey market premium (GMP) for DAM Capital IPO is Rs 160 above the upper price band, suggesting a listing price of approximately Rs 443.

DAM Capital IPO Listing Date

The listing date is scheduled for December 27, with trading beginning at 10 AM.

DAM Capital provides various financial services, including investment banking, broking, and research.

Publication Date: 26 December 2024

Caution prevails in the stock market as volatility continues. Following a 5% decline last week, the Nifty-50 index has shown minimal gains. Sumeet Bagadia recommends specific stocks for cautious traders.

The article emphasizes the importance of a stock-specific approach amidst market caution. Investors are advised to consult certified experts before making decisions.

item.title: DAM Capital Advisors IPO listing: Is strong market debut on cards? Check GMP - India Today
item.description:
DAM Capital Advisors IPO: Is Strong Market Debut on Cards?

Published On: Dec 25, 2024

Source: India Today

The DAM Capital Advisors IPO has garnered significant attention, being subscribed 81.88 times by the end of Day 3 on December 23, 2024, indicating strong investor interest ahead of its market debut on December 27, 2024.

  • The IPO was oversubscribed with the retail investor segment at 26.8 times, QIB at 166.33 times, and NII at 98.47 times.
  • This is a book-built issue valued at Rs 840.25 crore, comprising an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares.
  • The price band of the IPO is set between Rs 269 and Rs 283 per share, with a minimum investment of Rs 14,999.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) currently stands at Rs 170, suggesting a potential listing price of around Rs 453, equating to a 60.07% gain per share.
  • This IPO is managed by Nuvama Wealth Management Limited and registered with Link Intime India Private Ltd.
"Considering the price band of Rs 283, the estimated listing price for the IPO is around Rs 453, calculated by adding the cap price to the GMP."

The anticipation builds as investors look forward to the strong debut of DAM Capital Advisors on the stock exchange this Friday, further driven by positive market sentiment.

item.title: Nifty IT outperforms Nifty 50 in 2024; can this trend continue? Experts pick TCS, Infosys among top IT stocks to buy | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Nifty IT Outperforms Nifty 50 in 2024; Can This Trend Continue?

Date: October 2023 Source: Live Mint

As we approach the end of 2024, the Nifty IT sector has significantly outperformed the Nifty 50 index, prompting experts to identify leading IT stocks like TCS and Infosys as top buy recommendations for continued growth.

  • The Nifty IT index has gained nearly 23% compared to 11% for Nifty 50.
  • IT stocks such as Persistent Systems and Wipro have surged by 30-70% in a year.
  • Concerns over weak demand in key markets have not hindered IT stocks, supported by optimism about US Fed interest rate cuts.
  • Experts emphasize the potential of IT firms as they adapt to new technological trends.
  • Stock picks highlighted include TCS, Infosys, and HCL Tech for their strong market positions.
"Companies focused on cloud computing, cybersecurity, and artificial intelligence are likely to thrive as organisations prioritise digital transformation initiatives." - Rajesh Sinha

In conclusion, the outlook for the IT sector remains positive, with expectations of strong performance driven by evolving market dynamics and demand in key verticals.

item.title: From HNIs to retail, why were gold ETFs investors' favourites in 2024? Will their stellar performance continue in 2025? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Gold ETFs Surge in Popularity Among Investors in 2024

Publication Date: 2024-11-30 Source: Live Mint

In 2024, gold Exchange Traded Funds (ETFs) saw a remarkable increase in demand, quadrupling investments to ₹1,256 crore from November 2023 to November 2024, as a response to geopolitical uncertainties and market volatility.

Key Points

  • Significant growth in gold ETF investments noted, especially among HNIs and retail investors.
  • Factors influencing demand include geopolitical tensions, inflation, and stock market volatility.
  • Experts expect gold ETFs to remain popular into 2025 as uncertainties continue.
  • Discontinuation of the Sovereign Gold Bond Scheme may redirect investment interest toward gold ETFs.
  • Retail investors’ participation rose 76%, despite still holding a small share of 6% in AUM.
“Gold ETFs have witnessed a sharp rise in popularity throughout 2024, with AUM growing 64 per cent year-on-year.” - Mayank Jha

In conclusion, the ongoing global economic conditions are likely to keep gold ETFs attractive for investors in the upcoming year.

JM Financial has shared an array of stock picks for 2025, including notable companies like Maruti Suzuki and SBI, as analysts project a bullish outlook for the Indian equity market.

  • JM Financial recommends stocks including Maruti Suzuki, SBI, and Bharti Airtel.

“The investment upcycle should go on for another four to five years.” - Mahesh Nandurkar, Jefferies

In summary, 2025 looks promising for investors as leading analysts suggest strong potential in various sectors amidst anticipated macro-economic improvements.

item.title: Toyota global production down for 10th month despite rising sales | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Toyota Global Production Down for 10th Month Despite Rising Sales

Date: December 25, 2023 Source: Reuters

Toyota Motor's global production decreased for the tenth consecutive month in November, despite an increase in worldwide sales driven by strong demand in the U.S. and China.

  • Toyota manufactured 869,230 vehicles globally in November, down 6.2% year-on-year.
  • U.S. output declined by 11.8%, with a slow recovery noted as production for certain SUV models resumed.
  • China's production fell by 1.6%, an improvement over the previous month’s 9% decline.
  • Japan witnessed a 9.3% decrease in output, influenced by a two-day halt at some plants.
  • Worldwide sales rose by 1.7% to 920,569 vehicles, setting a record for November.
  • In the January-to-November period, global output was down 5.2% compared to the previous year.
'Toyota has decided to build an independent plant in Shanghai to manufacture electric cars for its Lexus brand starting in 2027.' – Nikkei

In conclusion, while Toyota faces production challenges, it continues to achieve record sales in a competitive market, signaling resilience amidst adversity.

item.title: Tata Capital IPO Date: Tata Group's new IPO in the works - All details - ET Now
item.description:
Tata Capital IPO: Details on Tata Group's Upcoming Offering

Updated: Dec 25, 2024 Source: Economic Times

A new IPO from Tata Group is on the horizon, with preparations underway for the Tata Capital IPO expected to launch by mid-2025.

  • Tata Capital, a leading non-banking financial company (NBFC) in India, is poised to initiate its IPO.
  • The Tata Group has begun discussions with bankers for a projected $2 billion IPO.
  • The RBI classifies Tata Capital as an upper-layer NBFC, necessitating a share listing by September 2025.
  • Current market valuation of Tata Capital is around Rs 3.5 lakh crore, with shares trading in the unlisted market.
  • If successful, this will mark Tata Group's second IPO in the last two decades, following Tata Technologies' IPO in 2023.
“Tata Technologies shares were issued at Rs 500 in IPO and made a bumper listing at Rs 1200.”

This IPO could significantly enhance Tata Capital's market presence and expand Tata Group's portfolio in the financial sector.
